title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 1 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: two die in crash and large part of a49 closed for the rest of the day .
services mark battle of the somme centenary .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for shropshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 monday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: watch : weather forecast for west midlands
text: a few showers will continue to feed in from the west this evening , before they gradually die away after midnight to a largely dry night with clear spells .
it will be a cool and fairly windy night .
minimum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .

documents.title: somme centenary : thousands pay tribute
text: thousands of people across the midlands have marked the 100th anniversary of the start of the battle of the somme .
the campaign in france lasted five months with the british suffering almost 60,000 casualties on the first day alone .
there 's more on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Cath Mackie
BBC News Online

documents.title: enterprise partnership wants to hear brexit stories
text: the marches growth hub , is asking businesses to share their experiences , following the vote to leave the eu .
it says it wants to hear from companies experiencing difficulties , but also from those which stand to benefit .

documents.title: watch : people in shropshire urged to back wales tonight
text: wales play their biggest football match in decades tonight , when they face belgium in the european championship quarter finals .
and with england out of the tournament , fans here in shropshire are being encouraged to support wales for a change .
author: Nigel Dolman
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : big crowd expected for fundraiser
text: more than 700 spectators are expected at an exhibition match at wrekin college next thursday .
former test match cricketers wasim jaffer and corey collymore will be the biggest stars playing for an invitational xi playing against a shropshire side .
cash raised from the match will go to shropshire ccc and the charities it supports .

documents.title: telford road maintenance jobs face cuts
text: road maintenance jobs in telford & wrekin are set to be axed .
roadworks and utility services contractor amey highways said funding cutbacks were to blame for seven posts being put at risk .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: watch : children in oswestry learn from wallace and gromit creators
text: the marches academy in oswestry held its first ever festival of education today .
and aardman animations were one of the organisations there , running a workshop for the children .
author: Sam Fleet
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : two die in crash ; two year sentence for baby kidnapper ; shropshire remembers the somme
text: these are our top stories this afternoon :
- man and woman die in crash which closes large part of the a49
- telford woman gets two years in jail for kidnapping baby
- shropshire commemorates the 100th anniversary of the battle of the somme
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: american football : revolution face tough task against falcons
text: the shropshire revolution play their final home game of the season this weekend , against the unbeaten leicester falcons .
their opponents lead the nfc ii south and have scored 320 points so far , conceding just 21 .
a win for the revolution would be a shock , so their game away to staffordshire surge on 17 july could be crucial , if they are to make the end-of-season playoffs .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hospitals explain how a & e might work in the future
text: the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford have put together this simple table , to explain where people will be treated if accident and emergency departments are reorganised .
the nhs trust running the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford says it would be better to have one main emergency centre in the county , but that will only affect people who are seriously injured .
those who currently walk into a & e with minor injuries will still be able to go to their nearest hospital and use what will be known as an `` urgent care centre '' .
the hospitals say there is `` misunderstanding '' about what the changes mean .

documents.title: telford woman tracks down grandfather 's resting place under the somme
text: events have been taking place across the uk and further afield today to mark the 100th anniversary of the battle of the somme .
three years ago , a woman from telford managed to track down the exact place her grandfather died on the same battlefield - believed to be a first .
normally , due to artillery fire and the chaotic nature of war , such a feat is impossible .
however , miners such as william arthur lloyd often fought a clandestine war in cramped spaces .

with the help of a team of archaeologists studying the la boisselle tunnels below the somme , lesley woodbridge retraced his steps to stand just feet from where he died - and where his body still lies .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury nightclub expansion proposals approved
text: a nightclub in shrewsbury has been given the go-ahead to expand to an upper floor - despite fears over the impact of the late night economy .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: breakingtwo people die after crash on a49
text: two people have died following a crash on the a49 near condover this morning , the ambulance service has just confirmed .
both were travelling in a car that was involved in a collision with a lorry .
the ambulance service said the car had suffered `` significant damage '' and the man and woman were in cardiac arrest .
bystanders had already started cpr before crews arrived to take over , but despite everyone 's efforts , the pair were confirmed dead at the scene , a spokesperson said .

documents.title: no lorry ban likely for ludford bridge
text: it 's looking unlikely that hgvs will be banned from ludford bridge in ludlow .
a lorry damaged a section in february , but a meeting last night was told that banning them might cause problems elsewhere in the town .
but councils and the local chamber of commerce have agreed to work together to draw up emergency plans , in case something similar happens in the future .
they will also look for supplies of suitable stone , for future repairs to masonry in the town .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : telford baby kidnapper jailed ; main road closed by crash ; somme remembered
text: these are our top stories this afternoon :
- telford woman jailed for two years for kidnapping baby
- large part of a49 south of shrewsbury closed because of crash
- shropshire commemorates 100th anniversary of the battle of the somme
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bradford sign defender knight-percival
text: bradford sign defender knight-percival

documents.title: weather watchers : stormy clouds over shropshire
text: we 're not forecast a lot of rain today , but there are some dark clouds covering the county .
here you can see photos taken by bbc weather watchers in newport ( top ) and ludlow ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: north shropshire mp backs leadsom
text: the north shropshire mp , owen paterson , has thrown his support behind andrea leadsom in the conservative leadership election .
we now know which way all of our mps are leaning .

the mps for telford and the wrekin , lucy allan and mark pritchard support theresa may , the shrewsbury mp daniel kawczynski backs michael gove and philip dunne announced on bbc radio shropshire this morning that he is behind stephen crabb .
andrea leadsom is the woman to lead britain out of the eu and towards a bright future | via @ twitterid
but it was ambiguous , if you take out santa 's promises , now all broken & proved to be deceptions then you 'd think again
need a strong pro-brexit leader at the helm - no dilution of 'free movement ' - everything else will sort itself
perhaps we could accept that a bunch of dishonourable liars swung just enough voters motivated by lies of a few
lies pouring out of the remain camp !
withholding the rise in pop'n by 1/2 million last year another example !
let 's see the £ 350 million , free mvt , impacts on economy , fishing , no model for trade , what a complete shambles ,
as it stands , nothing has changed , so how do you expect to see the benefits !
eu will be finished in 6 months !
i do n't expect to see them , i see losses & problems , loss of trust , losses , economically , loss of respect for mps
i see a lot of tantrums , sore losers and people who ca n't talk the nation down far enough .
eu is finished fact
just what everyone needs , support from someone who opposes same-sex marriage .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
why do n't you read her reasons why ?
she has diplomacy
i did read it ( it 's not that long , you know ) .
then you will know she did not vote against , she abstained .
against what ?
her wikipedia page tells the story of her voting for both sides
you misunderstood- my comment was re @ twitterid voting record on same-sex marriage , not @ twitterid
ah , now we are on the same page : - )
could n't agree more !
strong , passionate , intelligent .
make sure she gets the votes please !
she is courageous logical optimistic and welcoming !
she will get us a better deal !
no doubt .
@ twitterid @ twitterid prior to brexit i had not heard of her , now a firm fan .
@ twitterid @ twitterid yet another thatcher clone for the right wing and their media to ooze themselves over .
yuch .

documents.title: your photos : a poppy for somme anniversary
text: every day we ask the bbc weather watchers to share their photos of the weather around the county and nothing could be more appropriate today than this taken near norton .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: parents of kidnapped baby describe 'worst nightmare '
text: the parents of the baby kidnapped in telford in february have released a statement this afternoon , thanking the police and people who came forward with information which led to his return .
they said : `` what happened is every parent 's worst nightmare and the reality is worse than you can ever imagine .
`` while he was missing , we can not explain how we felt .
the thought that our practically newborn son was alone , frightened and in a strange place with someone he did not know is indescribable . ''
they went on to say that they are glad the case was now resolved and that they wanted to put it all behind them and watch their son grow up .

documents.title: travel : a49 to stay shut most of the day
text: the a49 near dorrington is expected to remain closed for much of the day , police say , following the earlier crash involving a tanker and a car .
a man has been airlifted to hospital , but the extent of his injuries are currently unclear .
diversions are in place , but there 's heavy traffic in the area , which is also causing delays of about 30 minutes on the a5 around the southern edge of shrewsbury , highways england reports .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : ludlow mp explains why he is backing crabb for pm
text: ludlow mp philip dunne was in the studio this morning , talking about a range of issues and while he was here he announced he would be backing stephen crabb in the conservative leadership election .
author: Jim Hawkins Show

documents.title: court hears how telford woman kidnapped baby
text: shrewsbury crown court heard kelly mahon had called at the family 's home and told the mother her husband had been involved in a car accident .
she offered to babysit while the mother went to check on her husband but then disappeared with the child .

the court heard mahon had told her boyfriend dwight dennis she was pregnant with his child in the hope of cementing their unstable relationship , but it emerged that mahon had been sterilised nearly 20 years ago .

documents.title: breakingbaby kidnapper jailed for two years
text: a woman who kidnapped a nine-week-old baby from his family 's home in shropshire has been jailed for two years .
kelly mahon , 41 , from arleston in telford admitted abducting the infant from a house in the town last february as part of a `` naive '' attempt to stage a fake pregnancy .
the child , who ca n't be named for legal reasons , was missing for three hours before information from residents led the police to mahon 's door .
the judge told her she would also be disqualified for life from working with children .
what was only a pipe dream suddenly grew into something real .
i can not begin to imagine the terror you caused the child 's parents . ''
author: Giles Latcham
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: crunch meeting for campaign to save bishop 's castle leisure centre
text: a crunch meeting is being held to drum up support for bishop 's castle 's under-threat sparc leisure centre .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: travel : disruption on a49 now affecting traffic on a5
text: the closure of the a49 between bayston hill and church stretton is now having a knock-on effect on traffic on the a5 around the southern edge of shrewsbury .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : dry for most of the day with some rain late on
text: it 's going to be a mostly dry day , but there could be some showers this evening .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: man and woman hurt in a49 crash
text: a man and a woman are being treated by paramedics after a crash between a car and a tanker near condover in the last hour .
west midlands ambulance service ca n't yet say how serious their injuries are , but the air ambulance has been called from cosford .
the accident has closed the a49 between bayston hill and church stretton .

documents.title: photo : shrewsbury town groundsmen find shrew in stadium
text: look what the groundsmen at the greenhous meadow have found today - a little shrew .
maybe it could be a mascot for the new season ?
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingaccident likely to close large section of a49 for rest of day
text: police say a collision involving a car and a tanker near condover is likely to close the a49 between bayston hill and church stretton for most of the day .
it was reported to them at 11:10 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: concern over hospital stroke services
text: the patients group healthwatch shropshire is worried that the royal shrewsbury hospital could be without stroke consultants for some time .
two have recently left and specialist stroke services will all be based in telford until replacements can be found .
but jane randall-smith from healthwatch shropshire says that it could be november before new recruits take up their posts .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: somme helps forge legend of wilfred owen
text: for many , wilfred owen is the ultimate voice from world war one , his poetry summing up the horrors of trench warfare .
born in oswestry and later moving to shrewsbury , the somme was to play a big part in his poetry .
a year after the main battle , he became trapped underground during fighting and was sent to scotland to recuperate , suffering from shellshock .
it was there , at craiglockhart , that he met fellow poet siegfried sassoon , who encouraged him to develop his poetry - helping to express some of his nightmarish visions .
owen would return to the frontline and remain there until his death in 1918 , days before the end of the war .
in that short time he would pen some of the nation 's favourite poems such as dulce et decorum est , anthem for doomed youth and strange meeting .

documents.title: ludlow mp backs crabb for conservative leader
text: the mp for ludlow , philip dunne , is backing stephen crabb in the conservative leadership election .
mr dunne described him as a `` very straight talker , clear thinker , highly principled , capable guy '' .
and mr dunne said the 43-year-old , who was born in scotland and brought up in wales was also best placed to reunite the party and the nation .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury mp describes gove as 'credible , honourable and experienced '
text: the mp for shrewsbury has described the conservative leadership candidate michael gove as `` very very credible , honourable and experienced '' .
mr kawczynski says he does n't know what went on behind the scenes between gove and boris johnson , but believes we are yet to hear the full story .

the shrewsbury mp had previously said he would like a woman to be the next prime minister , but he ruled out theresa may , because she supported the remain campaign and andrea leadsom , because of her lack of experience in government .

documents.title: commemorations to mark battle of somme anniversary
text: a number of events are taking place around the county today , to mark the 100th anniversary of the start of the battle of the somme .
the 15 soldiers from the parish of chetwynd who lost their lives are being remembered at chetwynd deer park .
a new avenue of 15 lime trees has been planted recently at the entrance and later a plaque will be unveiled , recording the names of the soldiers .
and earlier wreaths were laid at st michael 's church in shrewsbury .

documents.title: headlines : somme commemorations ; concern over stroke services ; farm celebrates birthday
text: our top stories this morning :
- commemorations to mark 100th anniversary of battle of the somme
- concern over hospital stroke services
- community-owned farm celebrates 10th birthday
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: delay in hospital theatre opening
text: the opening of a £ 15m operating theatre at the orthopaedic hospital in gobowen has been put back by five weeks .
equipment is now expected to start moving into the new building at the beginning of august with a final completion date in november .
a board meeting yesterday was told the delay would n't have a financial impact .

documents.title: ice hockey : former gb forward returns for telford tigers
text: the former great britain forward phil hill has agreed to another season with the telford tigers .
he was one of their top scorers last year , with 46 points in just 43 games .
head coach tom watkins has praised hill 's professionalism and believes he has kept himself in good shape .
he 's a great guy and teammate , who will lead by example with his work ethic and commitment , to both games and training through the week .
he sets a good standard for others to follow . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: community owned farm celebrates 10th anniversary
text: on this day , 10 years ago , charlotte and ben hollins from fordhall farm near market drayton reached their target of £ 800,000 to buy the property .
it was raised through donations and is now a community-owned farm , with thousands of shareholders .
when they started their campaign they had just six sheep but they say they now have a turnover around the £ 750,000 mark .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : wales game set to divide the county
text: the welsh football team has one of the biggest games in its history tonight and it 's going to divide shropshire , with many people choosing to support wales .
unsurprisingly this is causing tension near the shropshire border , particularly between jennifer and karl bridger , who run the llanymynech village shop just a few hundred yards inside wales .
jennifer 's stuck with wales , while her husband has backed england .
in our village shop , half have been supporting wales and half england .
now that england are gone , half of that half are going to be supporting wales and the rest are still england all the way . ''
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: latest : shrewsbury mp backs gove ; farmers discuss brexit ; nhs funding decision looms over shifnal practice
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- shrewsbury mp daniel kawczynski backs micheal gove 's bid to become leader of the conservative party
- representatives from shropshire will be at a national farmers union meeting this morning to discuss possible consequences of brexit
- the nhs is expected to decide by the end of next month whether there 's money for a new medical practice in shifnal

documents.title: travel : emergency repairs in quatt
text: temporary traffic lights are in place on the a442 in quatt , near dudmaston hall due to emergency repairs .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: a showery day with gusty winds .
the showers will become more widespread through the day , some turning heavy and thundery , with the added risk of hail .
feeling cool in the fresh winds .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for shropshire
text: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you want to share a story or you can email , tweet or get in touch via facebook .
